titleInfo.title: Dr. Charles Spivak Seated at His Desk

physicalDescription.extent: 2 item (photograph), 5 x 7 inches, black and white
physicalDescription.note: Handwritten on back of photograph: ''Dr. Charles Spivak at his desk, c. 1923.'' Handwritten on back of duplicate photograph: ''Dr. Spivak at his desk c.1920.''

mods.abstract: Dr. Charles Spivak sits at his desk with a copy of the Denver Jewish News opened in front of him and a telephone on an extension frame behind him. The JCRS was a sanatorium for tuberculosis patients that was founded in 1904 by a group of immigrant Jewish working men along with the support of several leading physicians, including Dr. Spivak, and rabbis in Denver, Colorado. It was located on West Colfax Avenue just outside of Denver.
mods.note: Appears in ''Images of America: Jewish Denver 1859-1940,'' by Dr. Jeanne Abrams, on page 85.
Donated by AMC Cancer Research Center (JCRS).
